pr_title: Show a tooltip on not yet researched hut blocks

timeline.message: Show a chat message when crafting a not yet researched hut block

Update src/main/resources/assets/minecolonies/lang/en_us.json

change chat message

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message

Replace chat message with a tooltip

The way it checks all items isn't finished yet, its just this way to
test everything else, cause i can't seem to find a good way to do that.
Fix abstractBlockHut formatting

Move some item code to the block

to remove the need for the item list.
Also add tooltips to some blocks i missed.

timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: this will be done on each chunk a player enters, might be a bit too much?
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I think this will only be done once, when the player leaves the colony.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: We do the list checks a lot here. So I'm not sure if this is called on every entry and exit of a chunk.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I have looked at every method calling this, and to me it looks like this is only called if an entity leaves a chunk into one that is claimed by another colony(or none), and if a player leaves a dimension.
replies.author: ToMe25

timeline.message:
Implement feedback

 * Fix AbstractBlockHut formatting
 * Add checkResearch(Colony, String) utility method
 * Move research rechecking in BuildingUniversity into the finished if
Add research name constants to the ResearchInitializer

timeline.bodyText:
Remember that the Block classes are merely definitions, so this is defining whether research is needed for every AbstractHutBlock blockstate, everywhere, in every world.
This information must be stored per ItemStack in NBT. Then the check needs to search through all ItemStacks in the relevant player'/s inventory for a relevant Hut and update the stack NBT.
timeline.author: ShadowProtocol
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -72,6 +78,11 @@
      */
     private static final VoxelShape SHAPE = VoxelShapes.create(0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9, 0.9);
 
+    /**
+     * Whether this hut is yet to be researched in the current colony.
+     */
+    protected boolean needsResearch = false;

replies.bodyText:
I will look this up later, but isn't addInformation client side only?
In that case its perfectly fine if its the case for every instance of the block, because its only whether or not the tooltip gets rendered for this player.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
I looked it up, and in BlockItem addInformation is @OnlyIn(Dist.CLIENT), so i think it should be fine on servers too.
I will test whether it actually works on a dedicated server, but i don't know why it wouldn't.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
Finally figured out why it might not work xD
Its because the colony check only works server side, but is nbt really the only solution?
Couldn't the client store it somewhere, and it wouldn't be that much of a performance hit.
The client needs to know the researches anywhere anyways, can't i just use that for the check then?
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: The research effects are synched to the client afaik
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I know that addInformation is Client only, that's not what I am referring to. It's the other stuff that isn't client side only that may cause problems, like the needsResearch variable on the server (which is not purely Client based). It will be reflected through all the other blockstates. Sorry if I'm not making sense, but this problem is probably not very obvious with only one player.
replies.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText:
this problem is probably not very obvious with only one player.

It is. I just tested it, and the tooltips just aren't showing up at all on a dedicated server.

The research effects are synched to the client afaik

Thx, i will look for them.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: The only thing not working with the new commit, is if you leave a colony into wilderness, it keeps all the tooltips, even after going into another world.
replies.author: ToMe25

timeline.bodyText: You need to check this from the stack's NBT here, as it is the only thing that is actually representing the item "instance" the player is working with.
timeline.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText: I prefer solutions that don't require nbt on every itemstack, even the forge docu says something like "don't use itemstack nbt if not absolutely necessary".
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: Yeah, custom nbt data on stacks might cause numerous issues as they won't be accepted by the builder for example anymore
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.message: Make the tooltip work on dedicated servers
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message
Reset research messages on world unloading

Check whether the player is actually inside the colony

before checking the tooltips

Add @OnlyIn(Dist.CLIENT) to all the client side only methods.

adding it to the needsResearch field would cause the server to crash.
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message

timeline.bodyText: This is introducing a circular dependency. Maybe some of the research stuff can be boosted into the API?
timeline.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText:
The Item is necessary in this class, because this class is the one that needs to register it, also moving the item to the api shouldn't cause any problems.
I am however not sure how to handle UnlockBuildingResearchEffect, as it would be possible to not use it in here by moving the checkResearch(IColony, String) method to a utility class.
I don't think there is a utility class where it would fit tho.
replies.author: ToMe25
